title: Why do Paganini's 5th and 24th caprices seem to be the most popular? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because they’re two of the most difficult—and most difficult sounding—caprices he ever wrote. Not to mention, they are also some of the most challenging pieces in violin repertoire. The 24th caprice’s main theme is quite recognizable and countless composers, including some of the most highly regarded composers of all time, i.e. Brahms, Rachmaninoff and Liszt all wrote variations on it. As well, many violinists perform these pieces to show-off their technique and playing ability, these pieces get played especially often because they sound difficult—and the 24th is again, very famous. Because these pieces sound difficult, even to audiences that may be unfamiliar with classical music or violin-playing, these pieces still sound very difficult.
